en: 6th Ordnance MM Co in the European War, 6 June 44 - 8 May 45
Route map with cartoon illustrations, unit roster, timeline
Canvas for 6th Ordnance MM Co in the European War, 6 June 44 - 8 May 45

body.value: A set of four pictures displayed on a wall. Pictures are all of women in the nude.
A caption with the words "Couchez Avec." A shortened version of the French phrase meaning, "Do you want to sleep with me tonight?" Voulez-vous coucher avec moi ce soir.
A barrel with various containers of alcohol nearby.
A man in the nude, presumably an American soldier, bathing himself. A crowd of four women and one child are nearby watching the man.
Cartoon drawing of a pile of American newspapers, army newspapers "Stars Strips"/"Stars and Stripes" and "YANK"
A cartoon drawing depicting stacks of letters in envelopes. A brown bag with the word "MAIL" on it.
Wall inscription of the words "VERBODEN TOEGANG" accompanied by a swastika.

Caption that reads, "Bleiche: Apr. 14th: Pleasant park area; quarters in apartment houses; Military Government problem; Division discovered 2000 starved Jews 25 were dead and more dying; War ends May 3,1945"
Wrecked wall with an inscription that reads, "BOCHE KAPUT."
The insignia (from left to right) of the 30th Infantry Division, the First Army, and the Ninth Army.
A spread of playing cards accompanied by dice.

Map's title text box.

"6TH ORDNANCE MM CO.

In Memoriam - S/Sgt. Edgar E. Holmes, Killed in Action

IN THE EUROPEAN WAR

6 JUNE 44 - 8 MAY 45"

"6TH" features a cartoon drawing of the number "6" with arms in boxing gloves, legs, and shoes.

Five Battle Stars.

seo.title: 6th Ordnance MM Co in the European War, 6 June 44 - 8 May 45 - World War II Service Maps
